titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress in reaffirming the United States of America as a republic.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 12/4/2000--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that the United States is a republic, not a democracy, and that the present constitutionally prescribed means by which the President and Vice President are selected State by State is essential to preserving the diversity of the citizenry of the United States and to maintaining the United States as a Federal republic composed of independent and sovereign States.
